article.description: Brown leads St. Francis (Pa) over CCSU 69-63
article.headline: Brown leads St. Francis (Pa) over CCSU 69-63
article.linkText: Brown leads St. Francis (Pa) over CCSU 69-63
article.story: LORETTO, Pa. -- Earl Brown scored 25 points with 10 rebounds and four assists to lead St. Francis (Pa.) for its first back-to-back wins of the season with a 69-63 victory over Central Connecticut State Thursday night. Ronnie Drinnon and Ben Millaud-Meunier both added 12 points for St. Francis (5-15, 3-4 Northeast Conference). Brown, Drinnon, and Milaud-Meunier each are averaging more than 10 points per game. Brown earns his second double-double, and the Red Flash have won two straight to snap a three-game conference losing skid. Faronte Drakeford scored 21 points on 10-for-16 shooting and had eight rebounds to lead Central Connecticut State (5-15, 1-6), which has lost seven of its previous eight games. Matt Mobley added 14 points, including two 3-pointers. The Blue Devils shot 27 of 58 from the field and made four of their 13 3-point attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
